body:
Can we name this parameter `concentration` rather than `shape`? Three reasons:
1. tensorflow distributions calls this `concentration`, and we want to maintain compatibility: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/distributions/python/ops/bijectors/weibull.py
2. `shape` usually refers to a `torch.Size` of some tensor, and it would be nice to avoid confusing users.
3. Pyro distributions adds a `.shape()` method which would be incompatible with this parameter name.
body_html:
Can we name this parameter concentration rather than shape? Three reasons:

  1. tensorflow distributions calls this concentration, and we want to maintain compatibility: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/distributions/python/ops/bijectors/weibull.py
  2. shape usually refers to a torch.Size of some tensor, and it would be nice to avoid confusing users.
  3. Pyro distributions adds a .shape() method which would be incompatible with this parameter name.
body_text:
Can we name this parameter concentration rather than shape? Three reasons:

tensorflow distributions calls this concentration, and we want to maintain compatibility: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/distributions/python/ops/bijectors/weibull.py
shape usually refers to a torch.Size of some tensor, and it would be nice to avoid confusing users.
Pyro distributions adds a .shape() method which would be incompatible with this parameter name.
